articles.description: The killing of a top Iranian general has ratcheted up the anxiety of families of Americans held in Iran
articles.content:

articles.title: Carolyn Hax: Your in-laws have been sponges, and now they’re sour sponges
articles.description: She plans to take a pay cut to have more family time. Their only concern: Their meal ticket.
articles.content:
Adapted from an online discussion.
Dear Carolyn: I am a litigation attorney at a great firm and feel lucky for a job I love (most of the time) that pays extremely well. It is also incredibly demanding, and will remain that way.

articles.title: Muslims in fear as police crack down in India's heartland
articles.description: Sometimes Arshad Hussain finds himself staring at the concrete path where his son bled to death last month
articles.content:

articles.title: Moon renews invitation for Kim to visit South Korea
articles.description: South Korean President Moon Jae-in says he hopes to see North Korean leader Kim Jong Un fulfill a promise to visit the South this year and has called for the Koreas to end a prolonged freeze in bilateral relations
